intro: Hyptis linarioides var. latifolia, commonly known as broadleaf hyptis, is a perennial herb native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its aromatic, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, pale blue to lavender flowers, which bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded to partially shaded areas. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is cultivated in gardens and used in traditional medicine.
